node.title: Roads scholar: Heather Ewart shares her top tips for holiday road trips
node.description: Let the Back Roads host help you navigate the best bits of the tracks less travelled, including the South Australian outback, Victoria's high country and a no-rush Nullarbor crossing.

node.title: ACT records seven new COVID-19 cases, one a close contact of Omicron infection
node.description: The ACT records seven new COVID-19 cases, including one which is confirmed as a close contact of Canberra's first Omicron infection.

node.title: Omicron cluster grows as health authorities investigate Western Sydney indoor gym
node.description: Health authorities are conducting urgent genomic sequencing on 10 cases, part of a cluster at a western Sydney school. Three of the 13 cases are confirmed as the Omicron strain.

node.title: Rust film set death could result in charges, says New Mexico district attorney
node.description: Some people on the Rust film set who were handling prop guns may face criminal charges in the fatal shooting of a cinematographer.

node.title: Some Bay of Plenty businesses still serving unvaccinated people
node.description: In the Bay of Plenty most of the region has moved to the orange light, but some businesses have chosen to do things differently.

node.title: Britney Spears says she endured years of forced therapy
node.description: The singer celebrated her 40th birthday Thursday, posting several Instagrams about her newfound freedom.

node.title: Accused King Soopers shooter deemed mentally incompetent to stand trial
node.description: Alissa faces 10 counts of first-degree murder and more than 20 counts of attempted murder, among other charges.

node.title: Believe It or Not, I Like Some Things in Our Progressive Era
node.description: It’s good to acknowledge our past and our diversity.

node.title: Israeli Company’s Spyware Is Used to Target U.S. Embassy Employees in Africa
node.description: The hack is the first known case of the spyware, known as Pegasus, being used against American officials.

node.title: Money Found by Plumber at Joel Osteen’s Church Is Tied to 2014 Burglary, Police Say
node.description: The discovery was revealed when the plumber called into a Houston radio show on Thursday.

node.title: Omicron Variant Spreading Twice as Quickly as Delta in South Africa
node.description: A new mathematical analysis strengthens concerns about the effects of the new variant on the pandemic’s course.

node.title: Thousands of Striking Columbia Grad Student Workers Threatened via Email With Replacement
node.description: The university told the students that those who return after December 10 "will be appointed/assigned to suitable positions if available."

node.title: State Department Employees Working in Uganda Had iPhones Hacked With NSO Group Software
node.description: NSO Group said it would investigate the incident, and, if it showed NSO technology was in fact used, terminate the customers and seek legal action against them.

node.title: Shutdown Showdowns Give Minority Parties a Powerful Platform
node.description: Over several months, lawmakers have struggled to work on a real annual federal spending plan, as Democrats claim Republicans have resisted engaging in serious talks that would advance the effort.

node.title: Suburban NYC Police Dept. Investigated for Alleged Illegal Strip Searches, Excessive Force
node.description: Federal prosecutors announced the investigation Friday, citing previous reports of racially motivated excessive force and illegal strip searches.

node.title: Ex-KKK Leader Running as Republican for Office in Georgia
node.description: Doles said the breakup of the U.S. is "inevitable." He also remains in contact with well-known white supremacists on social media.

node.title: Retailers Push for Stronger Law for California Store Theft After Smash-and-Grab Robberies
node.description: "We feel a little bit like we're under assault," said California Retailers Association President and CEO Rachel Michelin.

node.title: Sports Betting Industry Ponders if Relentless Advertising Is Overkill for Viewers, Fans
node.description: "Is it annoying?" asked Bill Miller, president of the American Gambling Association. "Is it too much? It is an unsustainable thing."

node.title: WNBL set to light up with World Cup on the horizon
node.description: After a dramatic year for women’s basketball in Australia, the WNBL provides the perfect chance to start afresh heading into next year’s World Cup in Sydney.

node.title: 'The virus is here earlier than we'd hoped': Seven new COVID cases in Queensland, four in the community
node.description: Queensland records seven new cases of COVID-19, four of which have been active in the community.

node.title: 'What Is a Black Life Worth?': Lawyer Angry Over $250K Bond for Cop Charged in Man's Killing
node.description: At a hearing Friday, Jason Meade pleaded not guilty to charges of murder and reckless homicide and requested that his case be moved to federal court.

node.title: SA borders to stay open despite Premier being 'extraordinarily concerned' about Omicron threat
node.description: South Australia's borders will remain open but all travellers from NSW, Victoria and the ACT will be required to have a test on arrival and isolate until a result is received.

node.title: More guns and fewer police officers blamed for spike in homicides
node.description: The violence is often claiming the lives of innocent children.

node.title: The window to lift the debt limit is narrowing, an influential think tank warns.
node.description: The United States could default as soon as Dec. 21 if Democrats and Republicans fail to extend the Treasury Department’s borrowing authority.

node.title: Woman Arrested on Drug Charges After Abandoning 4-Month-Old That Isn't Hers at Walmart
node.description: Two women were arrested Friday in connection to the abandoning of an infant, including the child's mother, at an Alabama Walmart that occurred Thursday night.

node.title: Wisconsin Gov. Tony Evers Vetoes 5 Abortion-Related Bills, Including 3 He Vetoed in 2019
node.description: "As long as I'm governor, I will veto any legislation that turns back the clock on reproductive rights in this state—and that's a promise," tweeted Evers.

node.title: Bird strike fears: Dunedin Airport opposes landfill
node.description: Extra efforts to stop birds flocking to a proposed landfill near Dunedin Airport may not be enough to allay fears of bird-strike on aircraft, the airport has warned.

node.title: More than 13,000 fake designer products seized in Los Angeles
node.description: Customs and Border Protection warned shoppers about counterfeit goods amid the holiday season.

node.title: South Africa probing "sharp increase" in hospitalized children with COVID
node.description: Officials say the Omicron variant is driving a "steep rise" of cases across the country.

node.title: Overlooked No More: Julia Tuttle, the ‘Mother of Miami’
node.description: She worked tirelessly to revitalize the area now known as Miami, and is widely recognized as the only woman to have founded a major American city.
